thread.title: danjmartin published Who are Labour's General Election candidates in Leicestershire?
thread.title_full: danjmartin published Who are Labour's General Election candidates in Leicestershire?

author: danjmartin
title: danjmartin published Who are Labour's General Election candidates in Leicestershire?
text:
Who are Labour's General Election candidates in Leicestershire? By danjmartin | Posted: May 03, 2017 0 COMMENTS SHARES Labour General Election candidates Heather Peto, Jewel Miah, Chris Kealey, and Andy Thomas Who are Labour's General Election candidates in Leicestershire? X 
Copy link to paste in your message / Comments (0) 
Labour has announced its slate of General Election candidates in Leicester and Leicestershire. 
As expected, Keith Vaz, Jon Ashworth and Liz Kendall have been re-adopted as candidates for the Leicester East, South and West seats respectively. 
Chris Kealey with have another crack at Tory David Tredinnick's 11,000 majority in Bosworth . 
General Election 2017: Click HERE for everything you need to know 
The former diplomat said: "I'm standing again in my home borough to prove what a local, positive and credible MP can do. 
"I will fight for a Brexit that benefits Bosworth. I'll battle for investment in schools, the NHS and social care. I'll continue to push on big issues that change lives, like opening Junction 2 of the M69 both ways to ease traffic and boost jobs. 
"I have the grit, skills and experience to get the job done. Petty politics leads nowhere. I want to prove what a good MP can do." 
Michael Mullaney will contest the seat for the Liberal Democrats. 
Labour's Harborough candidate will be Andy Thomas, from Market Harborough. 
The former head of traffic management at Leicester City Council will take on the candidate selected to succeed Tory Sir Edward Garnier, who is not defending his 19,000 majority. 
Zuffar Haq atands for the Lib Dems. 
Sean Kelly-Walsh has been selected again to stand against Conservative Ed Argar in Charnwood. He came second in 2015. 
Leicestershire county councillor Jewel Miah has been picked as Labour's challenger to Nicky Morgan in Loughborough, where David Walker represents the Lib Dems. 
Tory North West Leicestershire candidate Andrew Bridgen faces Labour county councillor Sean Sheehan, from Measham, and Lib Dem Michael Wyatt, from Coalville. 
Heather Peto will take on Tory Sir Alan Duncan in Rutland and Melton, where Lib Dem Ed Reynolds also stands, and Shabbir Aslam has been selected to take on Alberto Costa in South Leicestershire.
